message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This paper utilizes data from the FAO's Food Price Index and combines it with agricultural trade data from UN Comtrade to examine the relationship between food prices and international trade patterns.", "dataset": ["FAO's Food Price Index", "agricultural trade data from UN Comtrade"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we analyzed a nationally representative dataset of births in Brazil that covers the period 2000 to 2015, extracted from the Brazilian Live Birth Information System (SINASC), to assess the regional variation in early neonatal mortality rates.", "dataset": ["Brazilian Live Birth Information System (SINASC)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of employer-employee matched data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey Round 6 and firm-level survey data collected by the Ghana Statistical Service, we investigate the relationship between firm productivity and worker welfare in Ghana's manufacturing sector.", "dataset": ["employer-employee matched data from the Ghana Living Standards Survey Round 6", "firm-level survey data collected by the Ghana Statistical Service"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We examined patterns of financial inclusion and exclusion in India using household-level data from the All India Debt and Investment Survey, fielded by the National Sample Survey Organization (NSSO).", "dataset": ["All India Debt and Investment Survey"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Our analysis builds on survey data collected by the World Bank and International Finance Corporation titled 'Doing Business', which measures various features of business regulation across economies.", "dataset": ["Doing Business"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use Webscope advertising logs, which consist of a large collection of user-page interactions from a major search and advertising company, to investigate privacy-protected algorithms for targeted advertising in online search.", "dataset": ["Webscope advertising logs"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "The study employs qualitative and quantitative analyses, based on secondary data from the European Union to reveal the effectiveness of public-private partnerships in supporting the competitiveness of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) around Europe.", "dataset": ["data from the European Union"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws data from flood insurance records and property sales data at the zip code level to measure the relationship between flood risk perception and housing prices.", "dataset": ["flood insurance records", "property sales data"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Housing"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the relationship between economic inequality and environmental degradation, we use data on household consumption patterns from the World Bank Group's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS) and various indicators of environmental quality from the Environmental Performance Index (EPI).", "dataset": ["World Bank Group's Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS)", "Environmental Performance Index (EPI)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Finally, the study also utilizes multiple rounds of common nationally representative household surveys such as the Indian Human Development Survey (IHDS), combined with a new high-resolution map of India's road network created by the World Bank, to examine observed relationships between infrastructure development, household income growth, and non-farm employment generation.", "dataset": ["Indian Human Development Survey (IHDS)", "high-resolution map of India's road network created by the World Bank"], "topic": ["Infrastructure", "Jobs & Development"]}]
